Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 231,.proposition: Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 231, Section 85 establishes principles of contributory negligence and comparative negligence in negligence cases.

Mehanna v. Shaw's Supermarkets, Inc., 20.raw_text: Mehanna v. Shaw's Supermarkets, Inc., 2008 Mass. Super. LEXIS 333 (Mass. Super. Ct. 2008)
Mehanna v. Shaw's Supermarkets, Inc., 20.proposition: In Mehanna v. Shaw's Supermarkets, Inc., 2008 Mass. Super. LEXIS 333 (Mass. Super. Ct. 2008), the court held that a business has a duty to provide a safe shopping environment for customers.

Payton v. Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., 2000 Ma.raw_text: Payton v. Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., 2000 Mass. Super. LEXIS 88 (Mass. Super. Ct. 2000)
Payton v. Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., 2000 Ma.proposition: In Payton v. Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., 2000 Mass. Super. LEXIS 88 (Mass. Super. Ct. 2000), the court found that a business can be held liable for injuries caused by improperly stacked merchandise.
